Posts.Content: May 14, 2014 07:08PM LSpellin wrote: Well said, I couldn't agree more!  The one other thing I hate hearing is when someone is talking about something really bad and they compare it to a cancer.  When I would watch tv with my girls when I was first diognosed at stage 3 in 2009 and they would  hear that you could see how uncomfortable that made them. Lynette

Posts.Content: May 18, 2014 01:00PM LSpellin wrote: Hi JourneyOn, I'm pretty new to this as I just joined April 2014 and am still trying to navigate my way through.  On this question there are 18 pages before us that have signed in with stage 4.  And on my home page I listed my first diognose and then listed my new diognose but still haven't figure out how to list all of my treatments of chemo, radiation.... etc etc. So nice to meet you!  This has helped me so much in the feeling that I am not alone and any question I have I am able to fine or ask. Always lynette
Posts.Title: How Many Are We? DivineMrsM kt1966

Posts.Content: May 8, 2014 04:03PM LSpellin wrote: Thank you all so much for the warm embrace that I feel right now.  Sadly I know I'm not alone, but I feel so lucky to have found you all.  I have so many question regarding what's next and how do I deal with certain issues that come up, I know this will become a big part of my life going forward. Thank you again, Lynette
Posts.Title: Moving from lurking to being a true member lurkingnomore chris1959

Posts.Content: May 7, 2014 11:10PM LSpellin wrote: Hi, I also am new to this. I have been lurking trying to figure out where to start and when I saw your post I felt this is the right time for me to post as a true member. I was diagnosed  February 2009  with stage 3 breast cancer and went for a routine check up with my oncologist and she suggested I get a ct scan, boy was I caught off guard at my follow up when she told me that something showed up. Well one PET scan later March 17 2014 I was told my cancer has spread to hip and rib, almost 5 years to the date. I have already had 10 radiation treatments which has help with the pain and now have palliative care and get faslodex shots every other week. I am trying to figure out my new normal I just never feel good I am so uncomfortable in my body and I am always tired, with massive hot flashes, I don't know if they are panic attacks.  Will I ever feel good again?
Posts.Title: Moving from lurking to being a true member lurkingnomore chris1959

Posts.Content: Sep 14, 2014 03:35PM LSpellin wrote: hi cisco711 I was told on March 17 that my breast cancer had metastasize to my left hip and right rib to which I had radiation  and started falsadex and zoledronic infusion. I had been feeling pretty good except for some what I felt was break thought pain to my right hip.  I had a pet scan on Sept 9 and results on Sept 11 to which I was told my cancer has spread to both ribs both hips and a small spot on my liver!! The falsadex did not work at all. Of coarse I am devastated. I am going to go to Mass General to hopefully look into a clinical trial.  If you could please share win me what you a on or going to be on or even handling your diagnosis. I do not get any leg cramps and right now I feel pretty healthy. But my dr did not speak of having a liver biopsy. I would love to hear back from you. Take care and thinking of you, Lyn
